description: First developed during the United States for use in the second world war, the M15 White Phosphorous grenade gained notoriety (or perhaps infamy) for its use as an exceedingly effective obfuscation and enclosed-space clearing device. Its effectiveness lies in the white phosphorus vapors it uses for its assigned task, the acrid fumes nearly burning anything they touch and rendering any occupied space uninhabitable. Activate the grenade and then throw it!

description: An experimental hand grenade designed by the clandestine OSS during the height of the second world war, the T-13 is a hand grenade deliberately made to mirror a common American baseball. It was believed that this peculiar design would enable the T-13 to be thrown with ease by American servicemen, although the grenade's finicky contact fuse proved to make the T-13 a footnote in history compared to the more famous pineapple grenades. Upon being activated by pulling its fuse cap, the grenade will explode upon contact after being thrown?

description: This is a military-grade fragmentary hand grenade employed by the Japanese empire after its creation in 1931. It is fitted with a threaded base for the installation of a propellant cap so it may be used with the Type 89 grenade discharger.  Use this item to pull the pin and light the fuse.  You will then have five turns before it explodes; throwing it would be a good idea.

description: An black powder hand grenade that saw some among Union troops during the American Civil war. Shaped somewhat like a small football with an impact fuze at one hand and a long tail fin at the other end. This is the one pound version. Simply throw the grenade at the target to use it.
